intro: Mapinguari echinochilus, commonly known as the spiny beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, with small, spiny bracts that protect its flowers. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Mapinguari echinochilus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, open habitats.
